DOC.brief_title: Comparison The Clinical Effects Between Different Physical Therapy Tools Patellofemoral Pain Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Introduction : Patellofemoral pain syndrome ( PFPS ) common knee disorder . Factors cause patellofemoral pain include : use , soft tissue imbalance , malalignment low extremity . Patients patellofemoral pain , cause soft tissue imbalance think favorite receive physical therapy . Clinically , physical therapy patient PFPS include : Quadriceps strength training , tap , stretch exercise . The aforementioned treatment tool show different effect mechanism . However , clinical study compare clinical effect among aforementioned three treatment tool . The purpose study investigate different effect among quadriceps strength training , tap , stretch exercise iliotibial band patient patellofemoral pain syndrome randomize control trial study . Methods : An observer blind , prospective , factorial design randomize controlled trail . 90 young adult patellofemoral pain syndrome randomly allocate one three treatment group : ( 1 ) Quadriceps strength training , ( 2 ) taping , ( 3 ) stretch . Each group receive treatment 8 week . Outcome measure include visual analog scale worst pain , active-active joint reposition error test , Chinese version Western Ontario McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index , one repetition maximum record baseline intervention 8 week .
DOC.criteria: Anterior retropatellar knee pain present least two follow : ascending/descending stair , hop , run , squat , kneel , prolong sit Insidious onset symptom unrelated traumatic incident Pain palpation peripatella VAS > 3 Age < 50 year old Symptoms sustain 1 month Over activity : athlete , infatry Patients meniscal lesion , ligamentous instability , patellar tendon pathology , radiation pain spine , refer pain Neurological disease involve
